subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Stephen Ames wanted to escape the chill of Calgary for the final PGA Tour event, a decision that paid off yesterday when he closed with a four-under-par 68 for a one-shot victory in the Children’s Miracle Network Classic in Lake Buena Vista, Fla. Ames emerged from a typically crowded leader board at Disney with three straight birdies on the back nine of the Magnolia Course, then saved par from 65 feet out of the bunker to avoid a playoff with Tim Clark. “I came down here to work on my golf swing,” Ames said. “Here I am winning an event, which is awesome.”.
snippet: Stephen Ames wanted to escape the chill of Calgary for the final PGA Tour event, a decision that paid off yesterday when he closed with a four-under-par 68 for a one-shot victory in the Children’s Miracle Network Classic in Lake Buena Vista, Fla....
